name: orthosis
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a device made to support an injured or badly formed part of the body, or to help someone move it more easily: I have to use an ankle orthosis outdoors. She was fitted with a special back brace, called an orthosis.
More examplesFewer examplesSometimes an orthosis is required to keep the foot up and from dragging the ground.A static wrist-hand orthosis is often helpful in maintaining these joints in a functional position.You may be prescribed with customized shoe inserts called orthoses to help alleviate the pain.
